get.summary: List revisions.  By default, only branches are returned.

post.summary: Create a new pending branch, using the latest applied revision as the branch point.

get.summary: Information about a revision, including its state.

patch.summary: Update a revision, such as its state.

parameter-revision-revGet.name: rev
parameter-revision-revGet.description: The default is to query the operational state.  However, this parameter can be used to query desired state on configuration branches, such as startup and applied.  This could be a branch name, tag name or specific commit.

untagged.description: Interfaces added to this domain will, by default, be trunk interfaces with a single untagged vlan. Untagged packets on domain ports will be put in this vlan.  If none, then untagged packets will be dropped.

encap.description: Interfaces added to this domain will, by default, use this encapsulation.

priority.description: stp priority. The priority value must be a number between 4096 and 32768 and a multiple of 4096.

up.description: STP is enabled on this bridge

down.description: STP is disabled on this bridge

cue-show-schema-stp-stp-state.description: The state of STP on the bridge

mac-learning.description: Controls dynamic MAC learning over VXLAN tunnels based on received packets. This applies to all overlays (VNIs), but can be overridden by VNI-specific configuration.

enable.description: Turn the feature 'on', 'off', or 'auto'.  The default is 'auto'.

multicast-group.description: BUM traffic is sent to the specified multicast group and will be received by receivers who are interested in that group. This usually requires PIM-SM to be used in the network.

cue-show-schema-vxlan-head-end-replicati.description: Set of IPv4 unicast addresses or "evpn".

head-end-replication.description: BUM traffic is replicated and individual copies sent to remote destinations.

enable.description: Turn the feature 'on' or 'off'.  The default is 'off'.

forced-master.description: Configures PTP interfaces to forced master state.

acceptable-master.description: Determines if acceptable master check is enabled for this interface.

delay-mechanism.description: Mode in which PTP message is transmitted.

transport.description: Transport method for the PTP messages.

ttl.description: Maximum number of hops the PTP messages can make before it gets dropped.

message-mode.description: Mode in which PTP delay message is transmitted.

announce-interval.description: Mean time interval between successive Announce messages.  It's specified as a power of two in seconds.

sync-interval.description: The mean SyncInterval for multicast messages.  It's specified as a power of two in seconds.

delay-req-interval.description: The minimum permitted mean time interval between successive Delay Req messages.  It's specified as a power of two in seconds.

announce-timeout.description: The number of announceIntervals that have to pass without receipt of an Announce message before the occurrence of the timeout event

cue-show-schema-ptp-vlan-ptp-timers.description: VLAN PTP timers. Inherited by interfaces in this VLAN.

cue-show-schema-ptp-vlan-ptp.description: VLAN PTP configuration.  Inherited by interfaces in this VLAN.

vlan.description: Set of vlans in the bridge domain.  Only applicable when the domain type is "vlan-aware".

age.description: The time in seconds since the MAC address has been in the table

entry-type.description: Indicates whether entry statically configured or dynamically learned

interface.description: Reference to the base and/or subinterface for the MAC table entry

vni.description: vni associated with this mac table entry

src-vni.description: Source VNI used to communicate with dst ip in vxlan scenario

bridge-domain.description: Bridge to which the interface belongs

schema-ip-address-ip-address-def.x-cue-error: Not an IPv4 or IPv6 address

cue-show-schema-bridge-fdb-remote-dst.description: remote destination.  Example evpn remote vtep.

schema-bridge-fdb-mac-table-entry-id.x-cue-synopsis: Index for the MAC table entry

nexthop-setting.description: Specifies the next hop IP and MAC (Router MAC) to use in the advertisement of type-5 routes and “self” type-2 routes (“self” = SVI IP/MAC).  Relevant only in an MLAG configuration.

svi-ip.description: If 'on', the IP addresses of SVIs in all EVIs are announced as type-2 routes.  This configuration should not be enabled if SVI IPs are reused in the network.

default-gateway.description: This configuration should be turned 'on' only in a centralized-routing deployment and only on the centralized GW router(s).  If 'on', the IP addresses of SVIs in all EVIs are announced as type-2 routes with the gateway extended community. The purpose is for remote L2-only VTEPs to do ARP suppression and for hosts to learn of the gateway's IP to MAC binding.

mac-move-threshold.description: Number of MAC moves within a time window before the MAC is flagged as a possible duplicate.

This configuration should be turned 'on' only in a centralized-routing deployment and only on the centralized GW router(s).  If 'on', the IP addresses of SVIs in all EVIs are announced as type-2 routes with the gateway extended community. The purpose is for remote L2-only VTEPs to do ARP suppression and for hosts to learn of the gateway's IP to MAC binding.

Configuration file snippets that will be loaded as written into the
appropriate configuration file during a foundation unit's

gaps in the current CUE OM.

overwrite.description:
Determine which files can be overwritten during an apply.

When "all", then all files can be overwritten.  If the file was
locally modified, then a warning will be issued and the client
will have an opportunity to abort the apply before the local
modifications are overwritten.  This is the default.

When "controlled", then only files that were most recently
written by CUE can be overwritten.  If the file was locally
modified, a warning will be issued, but the file will not be
overwritten.

If set to 'helper-only', only the Helper role is supported for this peer. This means that the GR capability will be negotiated without any address-families with this peer.  If set to 'full', both the Helper role and the Restarter role are supported with this peer; the GR capability will be negotiated with the enabled address-families for which GR is also supported.

multihop-ttl.description: Maximum hops allowed.  When 'auto', the type of peer will determine the appropriate value (255 for iBGP and 1 for eBGP).  This is the default.

min-tx-interval.description: Minimum transmit interval.  The actual value used is the smaller of this or what the peer expects.

cue-show-schema-bgp-peer-bfd.description: Specifies whether to track BGP peering sessions using this configuration via BFD.

extended-nexthop.description: If 'on', the extended-nexthop capability defined in RFC 5549 is advertised to peer(s) with this config.  If 'auto', it will be 'on' for unnumbered peers and 'off' otherwise.  This is the default.

asn.description: ASN to use to establish the peering if different from the ASN of the BGP instance.  This configuration finds use during AS renumbering.  The local-as configured is also attached to incoming and outgoing updates.

prepend.description: When set to 'off', do not prepend the configured local-as to received updates; otherwise, prepend it.

replace.description: When set to 'on', attach only the configured local-as to generated updates, effectively "replacing" the AS number configured for the BGP instance with the local-as applicable for the peering; otherwise, attach the AS number of the BGP instance and then prepend it with the configured local-as.

keepalive.description: Keepalive timer.  If `none`, keepalives are not sent.  If `auto`, the global value is used.  This is the default.

hold.description: Hold timer.  If `none`, keepalives from the peer are not tracked and the peering session will not experience a hold timeout.  If `auto`, the global value is used.  This is the default.

connection-retry.description: Time interval at which connection attempts are retried upon a failure.  If `auto`, the global value is used.  This is the default.

route-advertisement.description: Time between route advertisements (BGP Updates).  A non-zero value allows route advertisements to be delayed and batched.  If `auto`, the global value is used.  This is the default.

route-reflector-client.description: Specifies if this peer is a client and we are its route reflector

route-server-client.description: Specifies if this peer is a client and we are its route server

soft-reconfiguration.description: If 'on', it means that received routes from this peer that are rejected by inbound policy are still stored. This allows policy changes to take effect without any exchange of BGP Updates.

nexthop-setting.description: Control nexthop value of advertised routes.  "auto" follows regular BGP next-hop determination rules.  This is the default.  "self" sets the next hop to ourselves for route advertisement, except for reflected routes.  "force" sets the next hop to ourselves for route advertisement including for reflected routes.

add-path-tx.description: Used to enable transmission of additional paths; by default, only the best path is announced to peers

aspath.description: If 'on', it means follow normal BGP procedures in the generation of AS_PATH attribute for this peer; if 'off' it means do not change the AS_PATH when sending an Update to this peer.

med.description: If 'on', it means follow normal BGP procedures in the generation of MED attribute for this peer; if 'off' it means do not change the MED when sending an Update to this peer.

nexthop.description: If 'on', it means follow normal BGP procedures in the generation of NEXT_HOP attribute for this peer; if 'off' it means do not change the NEXT_HOP when sending an Update to this peer.

replace-peer-as.description: If on, if the AS_PATH in an outgoing Update contains the peer's ASN, it is replaced with the local system's ASN

private-as.description: If 'none', no specific action is taken.  This is the default.  If set to 'remove', any private ASNs in the Update to the peer are removed.  If set to 'replace' any private ASNs in the Update to the peer are replaced with the ASN of the local system.

origin.description: If on, a received AS_PATH containing the ASN of the local system is allowed, but only if it is the originating AS

occurrences.description: Indicates max number of occurrences of the local system's AS number in the received AS_PATH

cue-show-schema-bgp-peer-address-family-.description: If enabled, it is acceptable for a received AS_PATH to contain the ASN of the local system
Options for handling AS_PATH for prefixes from/to peer for the specified address family

weight.description: Weight applied to routes received from peer; this is used in the BGP route selection algorithm

regular.description: If 'on', it means we can announce the COMMUNITIES attribute to this peer, otherwise we cannot.

extended.description: If 'on', it means we can announce the EXT_COMMUNITIES attribute to this peer, otherwise we cannot.

large.description: If 'on', it means we can announce the LARGE_COMMUNITIES attribute to this peer, otherwise we cannot.

advertise-map.description: route-map contains prefix-list which has list of routes/prefixes to operate on.

exist-map.description: route-map contains the conditional routes/prefixes in prefix-list.

non-exist-map.description: route-map contains the negative conditional routes/prefixes in prefix-list.

route-map.description: Route map to apply to Updates received from this peer

prefix-list.description: Prefix list to apply to Updates received from this peer

aspath-list.description: AS-Path filter list to apply to Updates received from this peer

route-map.description: Route map to apply to Updates to be sent to this peer

unsuppress-map.description: Route map used to unsuppress routes selectively when advertising to this peer; these are routes that have been suppressed due to aggregation configuration.

prefix-list.description: Prefix list to apply to Updates to be sent to this peer

aspath-list.description: AS-Path filter list to apply to Updates sent to this peer

policy.description: Optional route-map policy to control the conditions under which the default route is originated.

maximum.description: Limit on number of prefixes of specific address-family that can be received from the peer.  By default, there is no limit

warning-threshold.description: Percentage of the maximum at which a warning syslog is generated.

warning-only.description: If 'on', it means to only generate a warning syslog if the number of received prefixes exceeds the limit, do not bring down the BGP session.

reestablish-wait.description: Specifes the time in seconds to wait before establishing the BGP session again with the peer. Defaults to 'auto', which will use standard BGP timers and processing.  This would typically be 2-3 seconds.

cue-show-schema-bgp-peer-address-family-.description: Limits on inbound prefix from the peer for this address-family

outbound-policy.description: Allows outbound peer policy to modify the attributes for reflected routes. Normally, reflected routes have to retain their original attributes.
